original: Majjhima Nikāya 57
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Kukkuravatikasutta
analyzed: kukkuravatika sutta
translated: The Dog Duty

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā koliyesu viharati haliddavasanaṁ nāma koliyānaṁ nigamo.🔽Atha kho puṇṇo ca koliyaputto govatiko acelo ca seniyo kukkuravatiko yena bhagavā
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā koliyesu viharati haliddavasanam nāma koliyānam nigamaḥ  atha kho puṇṇaḥ ca koliya putto govatikaḥ acelaḥ ca seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ yena bhagavā
translated: Once the Buddha was staying in the Koliyan country at a town of the Koliyans named Haliddavasana. 🔽Then Puṇṇā, the Koliyan daughter, and the naked ascetic Sena the Dog Duty went to the Buddha.

original: tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā🔽ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Acelo pana seniyo kukkuravatiko bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi. Sammodanīyaṁ
analyzed: tena upasaṅkamisu upasaṅkamitvā puṇṇaḥ koliya puttaḥ govatikaḥ bhagavantam abhivādetvā  ekamantam nisīdi acelaḥ pana seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ bhagavatā saddhim sammodi sammodanīya
translated: After paying homage to the Buddha, Puṇṇā sat down at one side,🔽while Sena the Dog Duty exchanged greetings with the Buddha,

original: kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā kukkurova palikujjitvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: katham sāraṇīyam vītisāretvā kukkurā uva palikujjitvā ekamantam nisīdi
translated: and when this courteous and amiable talk was finished, he sat down at one side like a dog curled up in a heap.

original: Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: ekamantam nisinnaḥ kho puṇṇaḥ koliya puttaḥ govatikaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Seated at one side, Puṇṇā said to the Buddha:

original: “ayaṁ, bhante, acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko dukkarakārako chamānikkhittaṁ bhojanaṁ bhuñjati.
analyzed: bhante acelaḥ seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ dukkara kārako chamā nikkhittam bhojanam bhuñjati
translated: “Venerable sir, this naked ascetic Sena the Dog Duty is a doer of difficult deeds. He eats his food from a dish of ashes.

original: Tassa taṁ kukkuravataṁ dīgharattaṁ samattaṁ samādinnaṁ.
analyzed: tassa tam kukkuravatam dīgharattam samattam samādinna
translated: He has long been accustomed to this dog duty.

original: Tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo”ti?
analyzed: tassa kā gati kaḥ abhisamparāyaḥ ti
translated: What will be his destination, what will be his future state?”

original: “Alaṁ, puṇṇa, tiṭṭhatetaṁ; mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī”ti.
analyzed: ala puṇṇa tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: “Enough, Punna, let it be! Don’t ask me that!”

original: Dutiyampi kho puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho puṇṇaḥ koliyaputto govatikaḥ pe
translated: A second time…

original: tatiyampi kho puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho puṇṇaḥ koliya puttaḥ govatikaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: A third time Punna Koliyaputta the cowherd said to the Blessed One:

original: “ayaṁ, bhante, acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko dukkarakārako chamānikkhittaṁ bhojanaṁ bhuñjati.
analyzed: bhante acelaḥ seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ dukkara kārako chamā nikkhittam bhojanam bhuñjati
translated: “Venerable sir, this naked ascetic Senahaka the cowherd is a doer of what is hard, since he eats his food off a wooden platter, off a wooden bowl.

original: Tassa taṁ kukkuravataṁ dīgharattaṁ samattaṁ samādinnaṁ.
analyzed: tassa tam kukkuravatam dīgharattam samattam samādinna
translated: He has long maintained, long pursued, long undertaken the cow-duty.

original: Tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo”ti?🔽“Addhā kho te ahaṁ, puṇṇa, na labhāmi.
analyzed: tassa kā gati kaḥ abhisamparāyaḥ ti  addhā kho te aha puṇṇa na labhāmi
translated: What will be his destination, what will be his future state?”🔽“Punna, I certainly don’t get through to you when I say,

original: Alaṁ, puṇṇa, tiṭṭhatetaṁ; mā maṁ etaṁ pucchīti;
analyzed: ala puṇṇa tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: ‘Enough, Punna, let it be! Don’t ask me that!’

original: api ca tyāhaṁ byākarissāmi.
analyzed: api ca tyā aham byākarissāmi
translated: But still, I will answer you.

original: Idha, puṇṇa, ekacco kukkuravataṁ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, kukkurasīlaṁ bhāveti🔽paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, kukkuracittaṁ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, kukkurākappaṁ
analyzed: idha puṇṇaḥ ekaccaḥ kukkuravatam bhāveti paripuṇṇam kukkura sīlam bhāveti  paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa kukkura cittam bhāveti paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa kukkura ākappa
translated: “Here, Punna, someone develops the cow-duty fully and unreservedly,

original: bhāveti paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ.
analyzed: paripuṇṇam
translated: he develops the cow-virtue fully and unreservedly, he develops the cow-mind fully and unreservedly, he develops the cow-view fully and unreservedly.

original: So kukkuravataṁ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, kukkurasīlaṁ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṁ
analyzed: saḥ kukkuravatam bhāvetvā paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa kukkura sīlam bhāvetvā paripuṇṇa
translated: Having developed the dog’s virtue to its culmination,

original: abbokiṇṇaṁ, kukkuracittaṁ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, kukkurākappaṁ bhāvetvā
analyzed: abbokiṇṇa kukkura cittam bhāvetvā paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa kukkura ākappam bhāvetvā
translated: having developed the dog’s mind to its culmination,

original: paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā kukkurānaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇam kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā kukkurānam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: having developed the dog’s view to its culmination, with the breakup of the body, after death, he is reborn in companionship with dogs.

original: Sace kho panassa evaṁdiṭṭhi hoti: ‘imināhaṁ sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devo vā bhavissāmi devaññataro vā’ti, sāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: sace kho pana assa evadiṭṭhi hoti iminā aham sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devaḥ vā bhavissāmi devaññataraḥ vā ati sā assa hoti micchādiṭṭhi
translated: If he has the view: ‘By this virtue or duty or asceticism or holy life I will become a god or some other being,’ that is his wrong view.

original: Micchādiṭṭhissa kho ahaṁ, puṇṇa, dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhissa kho aha puṇṇa dvinnam gatīnam aññataram gatim vadāmi nirayam vā tiracchānayonim vā
translated: I say that this wrong view of his leads to two destinations: hell or the animal realm.

original: Iti kho, puṇṇa, sampajjamānaṁ kukkuravataṁ kukkurānaṁ sahabyataṁ upaneti, vipajjamānaṁ nirayan”ti.
analyzed: iti khalu puṇṇa sampajjamānam kukkuravatam kukkurānam sahabyatam upaneti vipajjamānam nirayanti
translated: Thus, Punna, when the dog’s life goes well, it leads to companionship with dogs, and when it goes badly, to hell.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko parodi, assūni pavattesi.
analyzed: evam vutte acelaḥ seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ parodi assūni pavattesi
translated: When this was said, the naked ascetic Sena’s son cried out and burst into tears.

original: Atha kho bhagavā puṇṇaṁ koliyaputtaṁ govatikaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavā puṇṇam koliya puttam govatikam etat avoca
translated: The Buddha said to Puṇṇa,

original: “etaṁ kho te ahaṁ, puṇṇa, nālatthaṁ.
analyzed: etam khalu te aha puṇṇa na alattha
translated: “I didn’t allow that, Puṇṇa.

original: Alaṁ, puṇṇa, tiṭṭhatetaṁ; mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī”ti.
analyzed: ala puṇṇa tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: Enough, Puṇṇa. Let it be. Don’t ask me that.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhante, etaṁ rodāmi yaṁ maṁ bhagavā evamāha;
analyzed: na aha bhante etam rodāmi yam mam bhagavān evam āha
translated: “I’m not crying because of what you said, Sir.

original: api ca me idaṁ, bhante, kukkuravataṁ dīgharattaṁ samattaṁ samādinnaṁ.
analyzed: api ca me bhante kukkuravatam dīgharattam samattam samādinna
translated: But I’ve been a cowherd for a long time.

original: Ayaṁ, bhante, puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko.🔽Tassa taṁ govataṁ dīgharattaṁ samattaṁ samādinnaṁ.
analyzed: bhante puṇṇaḥ koliya putto govatikaḥ  tassa tam go vatam dīgharattam sa mattam samādinna
translated: This Puṇṇa, Sir, is a cowherd.🔽He’s been a cowherd for a long time.

original: Tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo”ti?
analyzed: tassa kā gati kaḥ abhisamparāyaḥ ti
translated: What’s his destination, what’s his future state?”

original: “Alaṁ, seniya, tiṭṭhatetaṁ; mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī”ti.
analyzed: ala seniya tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: “Enough, Seniya. Let it be. Don’t ask me that.”

original: Dutiyampi kho acelo seniyo …pe…
analyzed: dutiyam pi kho a celaḥ seniyaḥ pe
translated: For a second time Seniya said to the Buddha,

original: tatiyampi kho acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: tatiyam pi kho acelaḥ seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: For a third time Seniya said to the Buddha,

original: “ayaṁ, bhante, puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko.🔽Tassa taṁ govataṁ dīgharattaṁ samattaṁ samādinnaṁ.
analyzed: bhante puṇṇaḥ koliya putto govatikaḥ  tassa tam go vatam dīgharattam sa mattam samādinna
translated: “This Puṇṇa, Sir, is a cowherd.🔽He’s been a cowherd for a long time.

original: Tassa kā gati, ko abhisamparāyo”ti?
analyzed: tassa kā gati kaḥ abhisamparāyaḥ ti
translated: What’s his destination, what’s his future state?”

original: “Addhā kho te ahaṁ, seniya, na labhāmi.
analyzed: addhā khalu te aha seniya na labhāmi
translated: “Surely, Seniya, I don’t get it.

original: Alaṁ, seniya, tiṭṭhatetaṁ; mā maṁ etaṁ pucchīti;
analyzed: ala seniya tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: Enough, Seniya, let it be! Don’t ask me that.

original: api ca tyāhaṁ byākarissāmi.
analyzed: api ca tyā aham byākarissāmi
translated: But still I will tell you.

original: Idha, seniya, ekacco govataṁ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, gosīlaṁ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, gocittaṁ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, gavākappaṁ bhāveti paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ.🔽So govataṁ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, gosīlaṁ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ,
analyzed: idha seniyaḥ ekaccaḥ go vatam bhāveti paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa go sīlam bhāveti paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa go cittam bhāveti paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa gavākappam bhāveti paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa  saḥ go vatam bhāvetvā paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa go sīlam bhāvetvā paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa
translated: “There is the case where someone develops the cow-duty, develops the cow-habit, develops the cow-practice, develops the cow-vow, develops the cow-obsession.

original: gocittaṁ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ, gavākappaṁ bhāvetvā paripuṇṇaṁ abbokiṇṇaṁ
analyzed: go cittam bhāvetvā paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa gavākappam bhāvetvā paripuṇṇam abbokiṇṇa
translated: Having developed the cow-duty, developed the cow-habit, developed the cow-practice, developed the cow-vow, developed the cow-obsession,

original: kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā gunnaṁ sahabyataṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: kāyassa bhedā param maraṇā gunnam sahabyatam upapajjati
translated: at the break-up of the body, after death, he reappears in companionship with cows.

original: Sace kho panassa evaṁdiṭṭhi hoti: ‘imināhaṁ sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devo vā bhavissāmi devaññataro vā’ti, sāssa hoti micchādiṭṭhi.
analyzed: sace kho pana assa evadiṭṭhi hoti iminā aham sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devaḥ vā bhavissāmi devaññataraḥ vā ati sā assa hoti micchādiṭṭhi
translated: If he has the view, ‘By this virtue or practice or asceticism or holy life I will become a great god or some lesser god,’ that is his wrong view.

original: Micchādiṭṭhissa kho ahaṁ, seniya, dvinnaṁ gatīnaṁ aññataraṁ gatiṁ vadāmi—nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā.
analyzed: micchādiṭṭhissa kho aha seniya dvinnam gatīnam aññataram gatim vadāmi nirayam vā tiracchānayonim vā
translated: I say that one of two destinations is to be expected for one with wrong view: hell or the animal realm.

original: Iti kho, seniya, sampajjamānaṁ govataṁ gunnaṁ sahabyataṁ upaneti, vipajjamānaṁ nirayan”ti.
analyzed: iti khalu seniya sampajjamānam govatam gunnam sahabyatam upaneti vipajjamānam nirayanti
translated: Thus, Seniya, if the cow-duty is successful, it leads to companionship with cows; if it fails, to hell.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko parodi, assūni pavattesi.
analyzed: evam vutte puṇṇaḥ koliya putto govatikaḥ parodi assūni pavattesi
translated: When this was said, the cow-duty ascetic Puṇṇaka wept and shed tears.

original: Atha kho bhagavā acelaṁ seniyaṁ kukkuravatikaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān acelam seniyam kukkuravatikam etat avoca
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the naked ascetic Sena, the pupil of the ox-duty ascetic:

original: “etaṁ kho te ahaṁ, seniya, nālatthaṁ.
analyzed: etam khalu te aha seniya na alattha
translated: “I have not gained my goal, Seniya.

original: Alaṁ, seniya, tiṭṭhatetaṁ; mā maṁ etaṁ pucchī”ti.
analyzed: ala seniya tiṭṭhata ita mā mama etam pucchi iti
translated: Enough, Seniya, let it be. Don’t ask me that.”

original: “Nāhaṁ, bhante, etaṁ rodāmi yaṁ maṁ bhagavā evamāha;
analyzed: na aha bhante etam rodāmi yam mam bhagavān evam āha
translated: “Venerable sir, I do not weep because the Blessed One has said this to me,

original: api ca me idaṁ, bhante, govataṁ dīgharattaṁ samattaṁ samādinnaṁ.
analyzed: api ca me bhante govatam dīgharattam samattam samādinna
translated: but because for a long time this cow-duty has been my practice.

original: Evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ, bhante, bhagavati;
analyzed: evam pasannaḥ aha bhante bhagavati
translated: I have confidence in the Blessed One thus:

original: pahoti bhagavā tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ yathā ahaṁ cevimaṁ govataṁ pajaheyyaṁ, ayañceva acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko taṁ kukkuravataṁ pajaheyyā”ti.
analyzed: pahoti bhagavā tathā dhammam desetum yathā aham ceva imam go vatam pajaheyya ayam ceva acelaḥ seniyaḥ kukkuravatiko tam kukkuravatam pajaheyya ati
translated: The Fortunate One is able to teach the Dhamma in such a way that I could abandon this cow-duty, and this naked ascetic Sena’s dog-duty.”

original: “Tena hi, puṇṇa, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tena hi puṇṇa suṇāhi sādhukam manasi karohi bhāsissāmi iti
translated: “Then listen, Puṇṇa, apply your mind well, and I will speak.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavato paccassosi.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho puṇṇaḥ koliyaputto govatikaḥ bhagavataḥ paccassosi
translated: “Yes, reverend Sir,” Puṇṇaka the cow-duty man replied to the Fortunate One.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Fortunate One said this:

original: “Cattārimāni, puṇṇa, kammāni mayā sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditāni.
analyzed: cattārimāni puṇṇa kammāni mayā sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditāni
translated: “There are these four kinds of deeds, Puṇṇa, which have been directly realised, well-proclaimed by me.

original: Katamāni cattāri?🔽Atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṁ kaṇhaṁ kaṇhavipākaṁ;
analyzed: katamāni cattāri  atthi puṇṇa kammam kaṇham kaṇha vipāka
translated: What are the four?🔽There is, Puṇṇa, a deed that is dark with a dark result;

original: atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṁ sukkaṁ sukkavipākaṁ;🔽atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṁ kaṇhasukkaṁ kaṇhasukkavipākaṁ;
analyzed: atthi puṇṇa kammam sukkam sukka vipāka  atthi puṇṇa kammam kaṇha sukkam kaṇha sukka vipāka
translated: there is, Puṇṇa, a deed that is bright with a bright result;🔽there is, Puṇṇa, a deed that is dark and bright with a dark and bright result;

original: atthi, puṇṇa, kammaṁ akaṇhaṁ asukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ, kammakkhayāya saṁvattati.
analyzed: atthi puṇṇa kammam a kaṇham a sukkam a kaṇha a sukka vipāka kamma kkhayāya savattati
translated: there is, Puṇṇa, a deed that is neither dark nor bright with neither dark nor bright result, which leads to the destruction of (volitional) deeds.

original: Katamañca, puṇṇa, kammaṁ kaṇhaṁ kaṇhavipākaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca puṇṇa kammam kaṇham kaṇha vipāka
translated: What, Puṇṇa, is the deed that is dark with a dark result?

original: Idha, puṇṇa, ekacco sabyābajjhaṁ kāyasaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṁ vacīsaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhaṁ manosaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti.
analyzed: idha puṇṇaḥ ekaccaḥ sa byābajjham kāya saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti sa byābajjham vacī saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti sa byābajjham manaḥ saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti
translated: “Here, Punna, someone creates a kamma that is to be felt as painful, creates an akusala kamma that is to be felt as painful.🔽Having created that kamma, he is reborn in a painful world.

original: So sabyābajjhaṁ kāyasaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhaṁ vacīsaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhaṁ manosaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.🔽Tamenaṁ sabyābajjhaṁ lokaṁ upapannaṁ samānaṁ sabyābajjhā phassā phusanti.
analyzed: saḥ sa byābajjham kāya saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā sa byābajjham vacī saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā sa byābajjham manaḥ saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā sa byābajjham lokam upapajjati  tam enam sa byābajjham lokam upapannam samānam sa byābajjhā phassā phusanti
translated: When he is reborn in a painful world, painful contacts touch him.

original: So sabyābajjhehi phassehi phuṭṭho samāno sabyābajjhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti ekantadukkhaṁ, seyyathāpi sattā nerayikā.
analyzed: so sa byābajjhehi phassehi phuṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ sa byābajjham vedanam vedeti ekanta dukkha sā iyyathā api sattāḥ nerayikāḥ
translated: Being touched by painful contacts, he feels painful feelings, extremely painful, as in the case of the beings in hell.

original: Iti kho, puṇṇa, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti;🔽yaṁ karoti tena upapajjati,
analyzed: iti kho puṇṇa bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti  yam karoti tena upapajjati
translated: Thus, Punna, there is the arising of beings in the world.🔽One is reborn because of what one has done.

original: upapannamenaṁ phassā phusanti.
analyzed: upapannam enam phassā phusanti
translated: When one is reborn, contacts touch one.

original: Evampāhaṁ, puṇṇa, ‘kammadāyādā sattā’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: evampā aha puṇṇa kamma dāyādā sattā ati vadāmi
translated: Thus, Punna, I say that beings are the heirs of their kamma.🔽“And further, Punna, I say that beings are heirs of their deeds.

original: Idaṁ vuccati, puṇṇa, kammaṁ kaṇhaṁ kaṇhavipākaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati puṇṇa kammam kaṇham kaṇha vipāka
translated: This is called deed that is dark with dark result.

original: Katamañca, puṇṇa, kammaṁ sukkaṁ sukkavipākaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca puṇṇa kammam sukkam sukka vipāka
translated: “And what, Punna, is deed that is bright with bright result?

original: Idha, puṇṇa, ekacco abyābajjhaṁ kāyasaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti, abyābajjhaṁ vacīsaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti, abyābajjhaṁ manosaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti.🔽So abyābajjhaṁ kāyasaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā, abyābajjhaṁ vacīsaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā, abyābajjhaṁ manosaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā abyābajjhaṁ lokaṁ upapajjati.🔽Tamenaṁ abyābajjhaṁ lokaṁ upapannaṁ samānaṁ abyābajjhā phassā phusanti.
analyzed: idha puṇṇaḥ ekaccaḥ a byābajjham kāya saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti abyābajjham vacī saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti abyābajjham manaḥ saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti  saḥ a byābajjham kāya saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā a byābajjham vacī saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā a byābajjham manaḥ saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā a byābajjham lokam upapajjati  tam enam abyābajjham lokam upapannam samānam abyābajjhā phassā phusanti
translated: Here someone abstains from killing living beings, from taking what is not given, from misconduct in sensual pleasures, from false speech, from wine, liquor, and intoxicants, which are the basis of negligence.🔽Having abstained from killing living beings, from taking what is not given, from misconduct in sensual pleasures, from false speech, from wine, liquor, and intoxicants, which are the basis of negligence, he is reborn in a good destination, in the heavenly world.🔽There he experiences exclusively pleasant feelings.

original: So abyābajjhehi phassehi phuṭṭho samāno abyābajjhaṁ vedanaṁ vedeti ekantasukhaṁ, seyyathāpi devā subhakiṇhā.🔽Iti kho, puṇṇa, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti;
analyzed: saḥ abyābajjhehi phassehi phuṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ abyābajjham vedanam vedeti ekanta sukha sā iyyathā api devā subha kiṇhā  iti kho puṇṇa bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti
translated: Thus, Punna, there is a deed that is bright with bright result.🔽“And what, Punna, is deed that is neither dark nor bright with neither dark nor bright result, with the result of neither-dark-nor-bright action?🔽Here someone destroys life, takes what is not given, engages in misconduct in sensual pleasures, speaks falsely, and indulges in wine, liquor, and intoxicants, which are the basis of negligence.🔽Having destroyed life, taken what is not given, engaged in misconduct in sensual pleasures, spoken falsely, and indulged in wine, liquor, and intoxicants, which are the basis of negligence, he is reborn in an inferior common family or a family of candalas or a family of hunters or a family of bamboo workers or a family of cart makers or a family of scavengers—in whatever family he is reborn, he is ugly, sickly, and feeble-minded.

original: yaṁ karoti tena upapajjati,🔽upapannamenaṁ phassā phusanti.
analyzed: yam karoti tena upapajjati 🔽upapannam enam phassā phusanti
translated: Thus, Punna, there is a deed that is neither dark nor bright with neither dark nor bright result, with the result of neither-dark-nor-bright action.

original: Evampāhaṁ, puṇṇa, ‘kammadāyādā sattā’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: evampā aha puṇṇa kamma dāyādā sattā ati vadāmi
translated: I say that beings are heirs of their actions.

original: Idaṁ vuccati, puṇṇa, kammaṁ sukkaṁ sukkavipākaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati puṇṇa kammam sukkam sukka vipāka
translated: This is called action that is bright with bright result.

original: Katamañca, puṇṇa, kammaṁ kaṇhasukkaṁ kaṇhasukkavipākaṁ?
analyzed: katamat ca puṇṇa kammam kaṇha sukkam kaṇha sukka vipāka
translated: “And what, Punna, is action that is dark and bright with dark and bright result?

original: Idha, puṇṇa, ekacco sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi kāyasaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhampi🔽abyābajjhampi vacīsaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti, sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi manosaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharoti.🔽So sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi kāyasaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi
analyzed: idha puṇṇaḥ ekaccaḥ sa byābajjham api a byābajjham pi kāya saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti sa byābajjham pi  a byābajjham pi vacī saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti sa byābajjham pi a byābajjham pi manaḥ saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharoti  saḥ sa byābajjham pi a byābajjham pi kāya saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā sa byābajjham pi a byābajjham pi
translated: Here, someone performs an action that is both afflictive and unafflictive,🔽with afflictive and unafflictive intention,

original: vacīsaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā, sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi manosaṅkhāraṁ abhisaṅkharitvā
analyzed: vacī saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā sa byābajjham pi a byābajjham pi manaḥ saṅkhāram abhisaṅkharitvā
translated: having performed an action that is both afflictive and unafflictive, with afflictive and unafflictive intention,

original: sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi lokaṁ upapajjati.
analyzed: sa byābajjham api a byābajjham api lokam upapajjati
translated: he is reborn in a world that is both afflictive and unafflictive.

original: Tamenaṁ sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi lokaṁ upapannaṁ samānaṁ sabyābajjhāpi abyābajjhāpi phassā phusanti.
analyzed: tam enam sa byābajjham api a byābajjham pi lokam upapannam samānam sa byābajjhā api a byābajjhā api phassā phusanti
translated: Then, in that world that is both afflictive and unafflictive, he experiences both afflictive and unafflictive contacts.

original: So sabyābajjhehipi abyābajjhehipi phassehi phuṭṭho samāno sabyābajjhampi abyābajjhampi vedanaṁ vedeti vokiṇṇasukhadukkhaṁ, seyyathāpi manussā ekacce ca devā ekacce ca vinipātikā.
analyzed: saḥ sa byābajjhehi pi abyābajjhehi pi phassehi phuṭṭhaḥ samānaḥ sa byābajjham api abyābajjham pi vedanam vedeti vokiṇṇa sukha dukkha seyyathā api manussāḥ ekacce ca devāḥ ekacce ca vinipātikāḥ
translated: He experiences both kinds of contact, painful and pleasant, and the feeling that corresponds to that contact is a mixture of pleasure and pain, as in the case of human beings, some devas, and some in the lower worlds.

original: Iti kho, puṇṇa, bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti;
analyzed: iti kho puṇṇa bhūtā bhūtassa upapatti hoti
translated: So, Punna, it is with birth that beings come to be.

original: yaṁ karoti tena upapajjati.
analyzed: yam karoti tena upapajjati
translated: One is reborn through what one does.

original: Upapannamenaṁ phassā phusanti.🔽Evampāhaṁ, puṇṇa, ‘kammadāyādā sattā’ti vadāmi.
analyzed: upapannam enam phassā phusanti  evampā aha puṇṇa kamma dāyādā sattā ati vadāmi
translated: When one is reborn, contact occurs through the six sense bases.🔽Thus, Punna, I say that beings are the heirs of their kamma.

original: Idaṁ vuccati, puṇṇa, kammaṁ kaṇhasukkaṁ kaṇhasukkavipākaṁ.
analyzed: idam vuccati puṇṇa kammam kaṇha sukkam kaṇha sukka vipāka
translated: This is called kamma that is dark with dark result or kamma that is bright with bright result.

original: Katamañca, puṇṇa, kammaṁ akaṇhaṁ asukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ, kammakkhayāya saṁvattati?
analyzed: katamañca puṇṇa kammam a kaṇham a sukkam a kaṇha a sukka vipāka kamma kkhayāya savattati
translated: “And what, Punna, is kamma that is neither dark nor bright with neither-dark-nor-bright result, kamma that leads to the destruction of kamma?

original: Tatra, puṇṇa, yamidaṁ kammaṁ kaṇhaṁ kaṇhavipākaṁ tassa pahānāya yā cetanā, yamidaṁ🔽kammaṁ sukkaṁ sukkavipākaṁ tassa pahānāya yā cetanā, yamidaṁ kammaṁ kaṇhasukkaṁ kaṇhasukkavipākaṁ
analyzed: tatra puṇṇa yam idam kammam kaṇham kaṇha vipākam tassa pahānāya yā cetanā  kammam sukkam sukka vipākam tassa pahānāya yā cetanā yam idam kammam kaṇha sukkam kaṇha sukka vipāka
translated: Here, Punna, the intention to abandon kamma that is dark with dark result,

original: tassa pahānāya yā cetanā—
analyzed: tassa pahānāya yā cetanā
translated: the intention to abandon kamma that is bright with bright result, and the intention to abandon kamma that is dark and bright with dark-and-bright result—

original: idaṁ vuccati, puṇṇa, kammaṁ akaṇhaṁ asukkaṁ akaṇhaasukkavipākaṁ, kammakkhayāya saṁvattatīti.
analyzed: idam vuccati puṇṇa kammam a kaṇham a sukkam a kaṇha a sukka vipāka kamma kkhayāya savattati iti
translated: This is called the deed that is neither dark nor bright with neither-dark-nor-bright results, the deed that leads to the destruction of action.

original: Imāni kho, puṇṇa, cattāri kammāni mayā sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditānī”ti.
analyzed: imāni kho puṇṇa cattāri kammāni mayā sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā paveditāni iti
translated: These are the four kinds of deeds declared by me after realizing them for myself with direct knowledge.”

original: Evaṁ vutte, puṇṇo koliyaputto govatiko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: evam vutte puṇṇaḥ koliya puttaḥ govatikaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: When this was said, the cowherd Puṇṇa said to the Blessed One:

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante
translated: “Magnificent, lord! Magnificent!🔽Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante …pe…
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante pe
translated: in the same way has the Blessed One—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.🔽I go to the Blessed One for refuge, to the Dhamma, & to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
analyzed: upāsakam mam bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇa upetam saraṇam gatanti
translated: May the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.”

original: Acelo pana seniyo kukkuravatiko bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: acelaḥ pana seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: But the naked ascetic Senahaka, the dog keeper, said to the Blessed One,

original: “abhikkantaṁ, bhante, abhikkantaṁ, bhante.
analyzed: abhikkanta bhante abhikkanta bhante
translated: “Magnificent, lord! Magnificent!🔽Just as if he were to place upright what was overturned, to reveal what was hidden, to show the way to one who was lost, or to carry a lamp into the dark so that those with eyes could see forms,

original: Seyyathāpi, bhante …pe… pakāsito.
analyzed: seyyathā api bhante pe pakāsito
translated: in the same way has the Blessed One—through many lines of reasoning—made the Dhamma clear.🔽I go to the Blessed One for refuge, to the Dhamma, & to the Saṅgha of monks.

original: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
analyzed: esā aha bhante bhagavantam saraṇam gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhu saṅghañca
translated: May the Blessed One remember me as a lay follower who has gone to him for refuge, from this day forward, for life.

original: Labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
analyzed: labheyya āha bhante bhagavato santike pabbajja labheyyam upasampadanti
translated: May I receive the going forth in the Blessed One’s presence? May I receive the full admission?”

original: “Yo kho, seniya, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhati
analyzed: yaḥ kho seniya añña titthiya pubbaḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajje ākaṅkhati
translated: “Seniya, anyone who was previously a monastic of another religion and who wants the going forth and the full ordination in this Dhamma and Discipline,

original: upasampadaṁ so cattāro māse parivasati. Catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū
analyzed: upasampadam saḥ cattāraḥ māse parivasati catunnam māsānam accayena āraddha cittāḥ bhikkhū
translated: must first be on probation for four months. If at the end of the four months the monks are satisfied with him,

original: pabbājenti, upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya.
analyzed: pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhu bhāvāya
translated: they give him the going forth and the full ordination to the state of a bhikkhu.

original: Api ca mettha puggalavemattatā viditā”ti.
analyzed: api ca mā ittha puggala vematta tā viditā ati
translated: But I know that there are differences in individuals.”

original: “Sace, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbā imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajjaṁ ākaṅkhantā🔽upasampadaṁ te cattāro māse parivasanti catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū🔽pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya, ahaṁ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi catunnaṁ
analyzed: sace bhante añña titthiya pubbāḥ imasmin dhamma vinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajjam ākaṅkhantā  upasampadam te cattāraḥ māse parivasanti catunnam māsānam accayena āraddha cittāḥ bhikkhū  pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhu bhāvāya aham cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi
translated: “Venerable sir, if anyone who was previously a monastic of another religion and who wants the going forth and the full ordination in this Dhamma and Discipline,

original: vassānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu, upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā”ti.
analyzed: vassānaṃ accayena āraddha cittāḥ bhikkhū pabbājentu upasampādentu bhikkhu bhāvāya ati
translated: must first be on probation for four months, and if at the end of the four months the monks are satisfied with him, they give him the going forth and the full ordination to the state of a bhikkhu, then I will be on probation for four years. If at the end of the four years the monks are satisfied with me, let them give me the going forth and the full ordination to the state of a bhikkhu.”🔽The naked ascetic Sena, formerly of dreadlocked ascetics, received the going forth, the full ordination,

original: Alattha kho acelo seniyo kukkuravatiko bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
analyzed: alattha kho acelaḥ seniyaḥ kukkuravatikaḥ bhagavato santike pabbajja alattha upasampada
translated: in the presence of the Buddha.

original: Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā seniyo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto🔽nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti, Tadanuttaraṁ—brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ
analyzed: acira upasampannaḥ kho pana āyasmā seniyaḥ ekaḥ vūpakaṭṭhaḥ appamattaḥ ātāpī pahitattaḥ viharantaḥ  kula puttā sammat eva agārasmai anagāriyam pabbajanti tad anuttara brahmacariya pariyosāna
translated: he, dwelling alone, withdrawn, heedful, ardent, & resolute,

original: diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
analyzed: diṭṭhe iva dhamme sayam abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi
translated: in no long time reached & remained in the supreme goal of the holy life, for which clansmen rightly go forth from home into homelessness, directly knowing & realizing it for himself in the here & now.

original: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
analyzed: vusitam brahmacariya katam karaṇīya na aparam itthattāya ati
translated: He knew: “Birth is ended, the holy life fulfilled, the task done. There is nothing further for the sake of this world.”

original: Aññataro kho panāyasmā seniyo arahataṁ ahosīti.
analyzed: aññataraḥ kho pana ayasmā seniyaḥ arahatam ahosi iti
translated: And thus the venerable Seniya became another one of the arahants.

original: Kukkuravatikasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ sattamaṁ.
analyzed: kukkuravatika suttam niṭṭhitam sattama
translated: The seventh sutta is finished.
